answerText: E2 [or bimolecular elimination][10] Direction of elimination is determined using this rule named after a Russian chemist, which states that most E2 and all E1 reactions give the more substituted alkene as the major product.
heading: ACF Winter |2009 | Lawrence U and Georgia Tech | 14 | Science | Chemistry | College
subject: Science
question: Question: Answer some questions related to elimination reactions for 10 points each.  [10] Using a strong, sterically hindered base favors this variety of elimination reaction. This type of elimination is typified by the removal of a halogen atom from an alkyl halide to form an alkene in one step.
